data.title: Benjamin Harrison Papers
data.meta_description: Selected Archival Resources For Library of Congress collections, please click on the catalog record links for a fuller description and additional links to available online finding aids, indexes, and digital collections.
data.text:
Related Resources

Selected Archival Resources

For Library of Congress collections, please click on the catalog record links for a fuller description and additional links to available online finding aids, indexes, and digital collections.

James Gillespie Blaine Family Papers, Manuscript Division, Library of Congress. LC catalog record.

Howard Cale Papers, Manuscript Division, Library of Congress. LC catalog record.

Grover Cleveland Papers, Manuscript Division, Library of Congress. LC catalog record.

Frederick Douglass Papers, Manuscript Division, Library of Congress. LC catalog record.

Stephen B. Elkins Collection, West Virginia and Regional History Center, West Virginia University Libraries, West Virginia University, Morgantown, W.Va. Finding aid available online External.

John Watson Foster Papers, Manuscript Division, Library of Congress. LC catalog record.

Walter Quintin Gresham Papers, Manuscript Division, Library of Congress. LC catalog record.

Elijah Walker Halford Papers, Manuscript Division, Library of Congress. LC catalog record.

Benjamin and Caroline Harrison Collection, 1851-1959, Miami University Library, Oxford, Ohio. Finding aid available online External.

Benjamin Harrison Collection, 1853-1943, Manuscript and Visual Collections Department, William Henry Smith Memorial Library, Indiana Historical Society, Indianapolis, Ind. Finding aid online External.

Benjamin Harrison Papers, 1852-1900, Manuscript Section, Indiana Division, Indiana State Library, Indianapolis, Ind. Finding aid available online.

Visual Materials from the Benjamin Harrison Papers, ca. 1888-ca. 1900, Prints & Photographs Division, Library of Congress. LC catalog record.

Benjamin Harrison Presidential Site Collections, Benjamin Harrison Presidential Site, Indianapolis, Ind. Collections described online External.

John Scott Harrison Papers, Manuscript Division, Library of Congress. LC catalog record.

Russell B. Harrison Collection, 1880-1908, Manuscript and Visual Collections Department, William Henry Smith Memorial Library, Indiana Historical Society, Indianapolis, Ind. Finding aid available online External.

Eugene Gano Hay Papers, Manuscript Division, Library of Congress. LC catalog record.

Irwin Hood Hoover Papers, Manuscript Division, Library of Congress. LC catalog record.

Henry Cabot Lodge Papers, Massachusetts Historical Society, Boston, Mass. Finding aid available online External.

Louis T. Michener Papers, Manuscript Division, Library of Congress. LC catalog record.

Thomas Collier Platt Papers (MS 727), Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library, New Haven, Conn. Finding aid available online External.

Matthew Stanley Quay Papers, Manuscript Division, Library of Congress. LC catalog record.

Reid Family Papers, Manuscript Division, Library of Congress. LC catalog record.

John Sherman Papers, Manuscript Division, Library of Congress. LC catalog record.

Harry Sievers, S.J., Papers, Department of Archives and Special Collections, Fordham University, Bronx, N.Y.

Benjamin F. Tracy Papers, Manuscript Division, Library of Congress. LC catalog record.

[Albert T.] Volwiler Mss., Lilly Library, Indiana University, Bloomington, Indiana. Finding aid available online External.

Related LC Online Resources

Benjamin Harrison: A Resource Guide

A Century of Lawmaking for a New Nation: U.S. Congressional Documents and Debates, 1774-1875

Chronicling America, digitized historic American newspapers. Available online through the Library of Congress. See also the following pages in “Topics in Chronicling America”:

Coeur d’Alene Mining Insurrection (1892)

Election of 1888: Harrison vs. Cleveland

Election of 1892: Cleveland vs. Harrison

Ghost Dance Movement of 1890’s

Homestead Strike of 1892

Johnstown Flood (1889)

Presidential Administrations: Benjamin Harrison

Wounded Knee Massacre (1890)

Congressional Information on the Library of Congress Web Site. Web Guide.

The Evolution of the Conservation Movement, 1850-1920

The Library of Congress Celebrates the Songs of America

Presidential Election of 1888: A Resource Guide

Presidential Election of 1892: A Resource Guide

Printed Ephemera: Three Centuries of Broadsides and Other Printed Ephemera

Prints & Photographs Online Catalog, Prints & Photographs Division, Library of Congress. Available online. The site offers a number of photographs and illustrations of or including Benjamin Harrison and associated people and events. Includes Historic American Buildings Survey study of the Benjamin Harrison House, 1230 North Delaware Street, Indianapolis, Marion County, Indiana.

U.S. Presidential Inaugurations: Benjamin Harrison. Web Guide.

Selected Writings by or Associated with Benjamin Harrison

Harrison, Benjamin. The Constitution and Administration of the United States of America. London: D. Nutt, 1897. LC catalog record.

Harrison, Benjamin. The Correspondence between Benjamin Harrison and James G. Blaine, 1882-1893. Collected and edited by Albert T. Volwiler. Philadelphia: American Philosophical Society, 1940. LC catalog record. Available online through HathiTrust External.

Harrison, Benjamin. Legal Aspects of the Controversy between the American Colonies and Great Britain: A Lecture by Benjamin Harrison. [Indianapolis?], 1894. LC catalog record. Available online through HathiTrust External.

Harrison, Benjamin. Messages of the President of the United States, Transmitting the Convention of February 29, 1892, between the United States and Her Britannic Majesty, Submitting to Arbitration the Questions which have Arisen between Those Governments Concerning the Jurisdictional Rights of the United States in the Waters of Bering Sea, etc.; and Also Transmitting Recent Correspondence upon that Subject with the British Government. Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1892. LC catalog record. Available online through HathiTrust External.

Harrison, Benjamin. Public Papers and Addresses of Benjamin Harrison, Twenty-third President of the United States, March 4, 1889, to March 4, 1893. Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1893. LC catalog record. Available online through HathiTrust External and Internet Archive.

Harrison, Benjamin. Some Hindrances to Law Reforms. An Address. Indianapolis, Ind.: n. p., 1897. LC catalog record.

Harrison, Benjamin. Speeches of Benjamin Harrison, Twenty-third President of the United States: A Complete Collection of His Public Addresses from February, 1888, to February, 1892. Compiled by Charles Hedges. New York: United States Book Company, 1892. LC catalog record. Available online through HathiTrust External. Reprint, Port Washington, N.Y.: Kennikat Press, 1971. LC catalog record.

Harrison, Benjamin. This Country of Ours. Second edition. New York: Charles Scribner’s Sons, 1897. LC catalog record. Available online through HathiTrust External.

Harrison, Benjamin. Through the South and West with the President, April 14-May 15, 1891. The Only Complete and Authorized Collection of President Harrison’s Great and Eloquent Speeches Made during the Tour. Compiled by John S. Shriver. New York: The Mail and Express, 1891. LC catalog record. Available online through HathiTrust External and Internet Archive.

Harrison, Benjamin. Views of an Ex-President: Being His Addresses and Writings on Subjects of Public Interest since the Close of His Administration as President of the United States. Compiled by Mary Lord Harrison. Indianapolis, Ind: The Bowen-Merrill Company, 1901. LC catalog record. Available online through HathiTrust External.

Miller, William B., ed. “Letters of Benjamin Harrison.” Journal of the Presbyterian Historical Society 37, no. 3 (September 1959): 143-154. LC catalog record.

Miller, William B., ed. “Letters of Benjamin Harrison (Continued).” Journal of the Presbyterian Historical Society 38, no. 1 (March 1960): 39-64. LC catalog record.

Paschen, Stephen H., and Leonard Schlup, eds. Presidential Campaign Letters and Speeches of James A. Garfield (1880), Benjamin Harrison (1892), William McKinley (1896), and William Howard Taft (1908). Lewiston, N.Y.: Edwin Mellen Press, 2010. LC catalog record.

Selected Biographies, Histories, and Other Related Works

See also Election of 1888 and 1892 for campaign biographies of Harrison

Calhoun, Charles W. Benjamin Harrison. New York: Times, 2005. LC catalog record.

Morrison, J. E. Life of Our President, Benjamin Harrison, Together with that of His Grandfather, William Henry Harrison. Cincinnati: The Economic Printing Company, for Lane & Morrison, 1889. LC catalog record. Available online through HathiTrust External and Internet Archive.

“Benjamin Harrison: A President at the Crossroads.” 2017. WFYI documentary. Available online External.

Sievers, Harry J. Benjamin Harrison. 3 vols. Second and revised edition. New York: University Publishers, 1960- LC catalog record. Volume 1 is available online on HathiTrust External. Reprint, Newtown, Conn.: American Political Biography Press, 1996. WorldCat catalog record External.

Sievers, Harry J. Benjamin Harrison. Hoosier President: The White House and After. Vol. 3 of 3 of Benjamin Harrison. Indianapolis, Bobbs-Merrill, 1968. LC catalog record.

Sievers, Harry J. Benjamin Harrison. Hoosier Statesman: From the Civil War to the White House, 1865-1888. Vol. 2 of 3 of Benjamin Harrison. New York: University Publishers, 1959. LC catalog record.

Sievers, Harry J. Benjamin Harrison. Hoosier Warrior: 1833-1865. Vol. 1 of 3 of Benjamin Harrison. Chicago: H. Regnery Co., 1952. LC catalog record.

Presidential Elections of 1888 and 1892

Baumgardner, James L. “The 1888 Presidential Election: How Corrupt?” Presidential Studies Quarterly 14, no. 3 (Summer 1984): 416-427. LC catalog record.

Bourdon, Jeffrey Normand. “Trains, Canes, and Replica Log Cabins: Benjamin Harrison’s 1888 Front-Porch Campaign for the Presidency.” Indiana Magazine of History 110, no. 3 (September 2014): 246-269. LC catalog record.

Boyd, James P. Biographies of Harrison and Morton. With Full Proceedings of the Chicago Convention and Authorized Text of the National Platform. Philadelphia: Franklin News Co., 1888. LC catalog record.

Boyd, James P. Men and Issues of ‘92. A Grand National Portrait Gallery, Containing Photographs of Leading Men of All Parties. Philadelphia: Publishers Union, 1892. LC catalog record. Available online through HathiTrust External.

Calhoun, Charles W. Minority Victory: Gilded Age Politics and the Front Porch Campaign of 1888. Lawrence: University Press of Kansas, 2008. LC catalog record.

Campbell-Copeland, T., comp. Harrison and Reid. Their Lives and Record. The Republican Campaign Book for 1892, with a Handbook of American Politics Up to Date, and a Cyclopedia of Presidential Biography. New York: C. L. Webster & Company, 1892. LC catalog record. Available online through HathiTrust External and Internet Archive.

Dawson, George Francis. The Republican Campaign Text-Book for 1888. New York: Published for the Republican National Committee by Brentano’s, 1888. LC catalog record. Available online through HathiTrust External.

Dozer, Donald Marquand. “Benjamin Harrison and the Presidential Campaign of 1892.” American Historical Review 54, no. 1 (October 1948): 49-77. LC catalog record .

Harney, Gilbert L., and Edwin C. Pierce. The Lives of Benjamin Harrison and Levi P. Morton, by Rev. Gilbert L. Harney. With a History of the Republican Party. By Edwin C. Pierce. Providence, R.I.: J. A. & R. A. Reid, 1888. LC catalog record. Available online through HathiTrust External and Internet Archive.

Knoles, George Harmon. The Presidential Campaign and Election of 1892. Palo Alto, Calif.: Stanford University Press, 1942. LC catalog record.

Knox, Thomas W. The Republican Party and Its Leaders: A History of the Party from Its Beginning to the Present Time... Lives of Harrison and Reid. New York: P. F. Collier, 1892. LC catalog record. Available online through HathiTrust External.

Messaros, Waldo. Life of Gen. Benjamin Harrison. A Full Account of His Ancestry ... and Recent Political Triumphs... Philadelphia: Political Publishing Company, 1892. LC catalog record. Available online through HathiTrust External.

Proceedings of the Ninth Republican National Convention, Held at Chicago, Ill., June 19, 20, 21, 22, 23, and 25, 1888. Chicago: Printed by Order of the Republican National Committee, 1888. LC catalog record. Available online through HathiTrust External.

Proceedings of the Tenth Republican National Convention, Held in the City of Minneapolis, Minn., June 7, 8, 9 and 10, 1892. Minneapolis: Harrison & Smith, Printers, 1892. LC catalog record. Available online through HathiTrust External and Internet Archive.

The Republican Campaign Text-Book for 1892. New York: Issued by the Republican National Committee, 1892. LC catalog record. Available online through HathiTrust External.

Short Review of the Public and Private Life of Gen’l Benj. Harrison. What the Working Men Say of Him. N. p., 1888. LC catalog record. Available online through HathiTrust External.

Wallace, Lew. Life of Gen. Ben Harrison. Philadelphia: Hubbard Brothers, 1888. LC catalog record. Available online through HathiTrust External.

Venezuela Boundary Dispute Case

British Guiana Boundary. Arbitration with the United States of Venezuela. The Counter-Case on Behalf of the Government of Her Britannic Majesty. 2 vols. London, England: Harrison and Sons, 1898. LC catalog record. Available online through HathiTrust External.

Cleveland, Grover. The Venezuelan Boundary Dispute. New York: Century Co., 1901. LC catalog record.

Cleveland, Grover. The Venezuelan Boundary Controversy. Princeton, N.J.: Princeton University Press, 1913. LC catalog record. Available online through HathiTrust External.

Documents Relating to the Question of Boundary between Venezuela and British Guayana. 3 vols. Washington, D.C.: McGill & Wallace, 1896. LC catalog record. Available online through HathiTrust External.

Rugg, Rowland. Anglo-American Boundary Question, as Stated by Great Britain, Venezuela, and the United States, in Their Official Despatches. London, England: Forster, Groom & Co., 1896. LC catalog record. Available online through HathiTrust External.

Venezuela-British Guiana Boundary Arbitration. New York: Evening Post Job Printing House, 1899. LC catalog record. Available online through Internet Archive.

Venezuela-British Guiana Boundary Arbitration. The Case of the United States of Venezuela before the Tribunal of Arbitration to Convene at Paris under the Provisions of the Treaty ... Signed at Washington February 2, 1897. 4 vols. New York: The Evening Post, 1898. LC catalog record. Volumes 1-3 available online through HathiTrust External. Volume 4, Atlas, available in Series 13 of the Benjamin Harrison Papers.

Venezuela-British Guiana Boundary Arbitration. The Counter-Case of the United States of Venezuela before the Tribunal of Arbitration to Convene at Paris, Under the Provisions of the Treaty between the United States of Venezuela and Her Britannic Majesty Signed at Washington, February 2, 1897. 4 vols. New York: The Evening Post Job Printing House, 1898. LC catalog record. Vols. 1-3 available online through HathiTrust External. Volume 4, Atlas, available in Series 13 of the Benjamin Harrison Papers.

Venezuela-British Guiana Boundary Arbitration. The Printed Argument of Behalf of the United States of Venezuela before the Tribunal of Arbitration. 2 vols. New York: Evening Post Job Printing House, 1898. LC catalog record. Available online through HathiTrust External.

Selected Related Resources

Baker, George W. “Benjamin Harrison and Hawaiian Annexation: A Reinterpretation.” Pacific Historical Review 33, no. 3 (1964): 295-309. LC catalog record.

Calhoun, Charles W. “Benjamin Harrison, Centennial President: A Review Essay.” Indiana Magazine of History 84, no. 2 (June 1988): 134-160. LC catalog record.

Calhoun, Charles W. “Civil Religion and the Gilded Age Presidency: The Case of Benjamin Harrison.” Presidential Studies Quarterly 23, no. 4 (Fall 1993): 651-667. LC catalog record.

Calhoun, Charles W. Conceiving a New Republic: The Republican Party and the Southern Question, 1869-1900. Lawrence: University Press of Kansas, 2006. LC catalog record.

Calhoun, Charles W. From Bloody Shirt to Full Dinner Pail: The Transformation of Politics and Governance in the Gilded Age. New York: Hill and Wang, 2010. LC catalog record.

Calhoun, Charles W., ed. The Gilded Age: Essays on the Origins of Modern America. Wilmington, Del.: Scholarly Resources, 1996. LC catalog record. Second edition, Lanham, Md.: Rowman & Littlefield Publishers, 2007. LC catalog record.

Cherny, Robert W. American Politics in the Gilded Age, 1868-1900. Wheeling, Ill.: Harlan Davidson, 1997. LC catalog record.

De Santis, Vincent P. “Benjamin Harrison and the Republican Party in the South, 1889-1893.” Indiana Magazine of History 51, no. 4 (December 1955): 279-302. LC catalog record.

De Santis, Vincent P. Republicans Face the Southern Question: The New Departure Years, 1877-1897. Baltimore: Johns Hopkins University Press, 1959. LC catalog record. Reprint, New York: Greenwood Press, 1969. LC catalog record.

Dearing, Mary R. Veterans in Politics: The Story of the G. A. R. Baton Rouge: Louisiana State University Press, 1952. LC catalog record. Reprint, Westport, Conn.: Greenwood Press, 1974. LC catalog record.

DiDonato, Louis A. “The Day the President Came to Town: Benjamin Harrison’s 1891 Visit to Southern California.” Southern California Quarterly 80, no. 1 (Spring 1998): 47-70. LC catalog record.

Frantz, Edward. “A March of Triumph? Benjamin Harrison’s Southern Tour and the Limits of Racial and Regional Reconciliation.” Indiana Magazine of History 100, no. 4 (December 2004): 293-320. LC catalog record.

Halford, E. W. “General Harrison’s Attitude toward the Presidency,” Century Magazine 84, no. 2 (June 1912): 305-310. LC catalog record . Available online through HathiTrust External.

The Harrison Album of Republican Leaders. New York: Economist Press, 1889. LC catalog record. Available online through HathiTrust External and Internet Archive.

Hirshson, Stanley P. Farewell to the Bloody Shirt: Northern Republicans and the Southern Negro, 1877-1893. Bloomington: Indiana University Press, 1962. LC catalog record.

Keith, Charles Penrose. The Ancestry of Benjamin Harrison, President of the United States of America, 1889-1893. Philadelphia: J. B. Lippincott Company, 1893. LC catalog record. Available online through HathiTrust External.

Lockridge, Ross F. “The Benjamin Harrison Memorial Home.” Indiana Magazine of History 34, no. 3 (September 1938): 307-318. LC catalog record.

Marcus, Robert D. Grand Old Party: Political Structure in the Gilded Age, 1880-1896. New York: Oxford University Press, 1971. LC catalog record.

McElroy, Richard L. Battlefield Presidents: Zachary Taylor and Benjamin Harrison and Their America. N.p.: McElroy, 2009. LC catalog record.

Memorial Meeting of the Bar of Indiana upon the Occasion of the Death of Benjamin Harrison: Held at Indianapolis, March Sixteen, Nineteen Hundred & One, in the Senate Chamber, upon the Call of the State Bar Association of Indiana & the Indianapolis Bar Association. Indianapolis: The State Bar of Indiana, 1901. LC catalog record. Available online through HathiTrust External and Internet Archive.

Moore, Anne Chieko. Benjamin Harrison: Centennial President. New York: Nova Science Publishers, 2006. LC catalog record.

Moore, Anne Chieko. Caroline Lavinia Scott Harrison. New York: Nova History Publication, 2005. LC catalog record. Reprint, New York: Nova History Publication, 2008. LC catalog record.

Morgan, H. Wayne. From Hayes to McKinley: National Party Politics, 1877-1896. Syracuse, N.Y.: Syracuse University Press, 1969. LC catalog record.

Noble, John W. Address at Dedication of Monument to Benjamin Harrison. Indianapolis, Ind.?: n.p., 1908. LC catalog record. Available online through HathiTrust External and Internet Archive.

Ogilvie, John Stuart, comp. Thirty Days with President Harrison. New York: J. S. Ogilvie, 1891. LC catalog record.

Our President from the Atlantic to the Pacific. Kansas City, Mo.: Hudson-Kimberly Pub. Co., 1891. LC catalog record. Available online through HathiTrust External and Internet Archive.

Perry, James M. Touched with Fire: Five Presidents and the Civil War Battles That Made Them. New York: PublicAffairs, 2003. LC catalog record.

Ringenberg, William C. “Benjamin Harrison: The Religious Thought and Practice of a Presbyterian President.” American Presbyterians 64, no. 3 (Fall 1986): 175-189. LC catalog record.

Seale, William. The President’s House: A History. Washington, D.C.: White House Historical Association with the cooperation of the National Geographic Society, 1986. LC catalog record. Second edition, Baltimore, Md.: Johns Hopkins University Press in association with White House Historical Association, 2008. LC catalog record.

Sievers, Harry J., comp. Benjamin Harrison, 1833-1901: Chronology, Documents, Bibliographical Aids. Dobbs Ferry, N.Y.: Oceana Publications, 1969. LC catalog record.

Sievers, Harry J. The Harrison Horror. Fort Wayne, Ind.: Public Library of Fort Wayne and Allen County, 1956. LC catalog record.

Sinkler, George. “Benjamin Harrison and the Matter of Race.” Indiana Magazine of History 65, no. 3 (September 1969): 197-213. LC catalog record.

Socolofsky, Homer E. “Benjamin Harrison and the American West.” Great Plains Quarterly 5, no. 4 (Fall 1985): 249-258. LC catalog record.

Socolofsky, Homer E., and Allan B. Spetter. The Presidency of Benjamin Harrison. Lawrence, Kan.: University Press of Kansas, 1987. LC catalog record.

Spetter, Allan B. “Harrison and Blaine: No Reciprocity for Canada.” Canadian Review of American Studies 12, no. 2 (Fall 1981): 143-156. LC catalog record.

Spetter, Allan B. “Rev. Harry J. Sievers, S.J., the Arthur Jordan Foundation and the Biography of President Benjamin Harrison.” Presidential Studies Quarterly 23, no. 3 (1993): 555-565. LC catalog record.

Spetter, Allan Burton. “Harrison and Blaine: Foreign Policy, 1889-1893.” Ph.D. dissertation. Rutgers University, New Brunswick, N.J., 1967.

Summers, Mark W. Party Games: Getting, Keeping, and Using Power in Gilded Age Politics. Chapel Hill: University of North Carolina Press, 2004. LC catalog record.

Summers, Mark W. “‘To Make the Wheels Revolve We Must Have Grease’: Barrel Politics in the Gilded Age.” Journal of Policy History 14, no. 1 (2002): 49-72. LC catalog record.

Volwiler, A. T. “Harrison, Blaine, and American Foreign Policy, 1889-1893.” Proceedings of the American Philosophical Society 79, no. 4 (November 15, 1938): 637-48. LC catalog record.

Williams, John Alexander. “Stephen B. Elkins and the Benjamin Harrison Campaign and Cabinet, 1887-1891.” Indiana Magazine of History 68, no. 1 (March 1972): 1-23. LC catalog record.

Williams, R. Hal. Years of Decision: American Politics in the 1890s. New York: Wiley, 1978. LC catalog record.

Wright, Marcia. “The Benjamin Harrison Papers.” Quarterly Journal of Current Acquisitions 18, no. 3 (1961): 121-125. LC catalog record. Available online through HathiTrust External.

Related Websites

Benjamin Harrison Presidential Site, Indianapolis, Ind. Website External.

Compiled May 2020
